intro: Androsace yargongensis, commonly known as the Yarlung Androsace, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are typically basal, rosette-like, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. This species is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
